response:
A Brown-Sequard thoracic myelopathy with back pain and fever is most urgently explained by a compressive lesion such as epidural abscess; intradural/epidural tumours and thoracic disc herniation are other common causes, while inflammatory demyelinating and vascular myelopathies are less likely but important in a young adult; traumatic hemisection and spinal complications of axial spondyloarthritis are additional considerations.

differential_diagnosis = ["Thoracic spinal epidural abscess causing left hemicord compression", "Thoracic intradural-extramedullary tumour (e.g., meningioma or schwannoma) causing left hemicord compression", "Thoracic intervertebral disc herniation causing left lateral cord compression", "Multiple sclerosis with partial thoracic myelitis", "Spinal cord infarction of a unilateral branch of the anterior spinal artery", "Penetrating or fracture-related traumatic hemisection of the thoracic spinal cord", "Axial spondyloarthritis with structural spinal lesion causing thoracic cord compression"]
